data.title: Fun atmosphere and great food!
data.text: The tacos among many other things are awesome. Don't forget the margaritas at happy hour! The pineapple margarita is exceptionally tasty!

data.title: Favorite Taco place
data.text: Favorite taco place in quaint downtown Gilbert.  Great variety of chef prepared meats and seafoods with unigue blended sauces.  I like that you can order a lot of food or just a small bite.  The atmosphere is very updated decor with a hint of hipster.  Margaritas and other beverages also a fav.

data.title: Nice tortilla chips
data.text: You may have to share your burrito, they are enormous! Center of Gilbert, lots of Pokestops and friendly service.

data.title: Excellent Tacos
data.text: Prices are great, you get a ton of food for the cost. Service is fast and professional, great for friend and families. Excellent tacos!!!

data.title: Restaurant
data.text: This is one of my favorite places!! I love bring out of town guest to this restaurant!! For I i get to enjoy there tacos!! I love all of them so you cant go wrong with your order!! Also the mexican corn is a must our for them!!

data.title: Another winner in downtown Gilbert
data.text: Word of warning...if you go on Taco Tuesday either be there at opening or be prepared to wait. Good tacos and drinks. GREAT, and I mean REALLY GREAT service.  Team concept that really works. Fairly priced and obviously very popular.

data.title: Great find!  Delicious fare at a good price
data.text: We found this place as we were leaving town, in a relative hurry, and were very pleasantly surprised!  Cool funky ambiance, great menu, delicious salads.  We all had the lunch special -- two tacos and a salad.  The tacos (fish, carnitas) were great and the salads creative and good.  Worth a stop.

data.title: Delicious!!
data.text: What better time to make my first visit to JOYRIDE than on National Taco Day?! The tacos were sooooo good and fresh. I tried three different tacos and all were great. Try the blood orange margarita as well!

data.title: An unexpected treat
data.text: After a long weekend soccer tournament we were looking for a simple dinner. Coming from New Mexico I wasn't too excited to try Mexican food in Arizona, but I'm glad I did. The taco choices were well thought out and my expectations were exceeded. This restaurant is in a cool area with many other restaurants. Service was fair, but the food came quickly and it was very good.

data.title: Gourmet, Well-Stuffed Tacos
data.text:
This is a fun place with good food, great service, and a nice outdoor patio.  If you go during happy hour (4:00-6:00), most of their $3.75-$4.50 tacos are only $2.  And these aren't ordinary tacos.  They're stuffed to overflowing with lean meat and a variety of veggies.  I had The Standard (slow roasted chicken, slaw, and avocado) and Pork Adoba (shredded pork, cabbage, radish, cilantro).  My friend had a Carne Asada taco and a Grilled Shrimp one.

We asked about sharing sides, but it was suggested we get our own.  I agree about the Mexican corn.  My friend said it was the best corn she ever had.  We both ate every last kernel out of our bowls.  It was grilled on the cob, which can be removed if you request, then mixed with cojita cheese, a little mayo, and paprika.  Soooo good!

On that orange and cucumber salad, two people could easily share it, unless you have a craving to eat an entire English cucumber by yourself.  Besides a few orange pieces and light dressing, there was nothing else. 

The service was very good, very attentive even before we asked. Even the salsa that came with the chips was excellent.  We would have liked to try Mo's Definitely dessert, but were too full.  However, worth another trip just for that.

data.title: A little disappointed.
data.text: There was a lot of hype about this place and I wasnt too impressed. Their food was decent but nothing wonderful. Their drink selection, however was great. I feel this place is overpriced for what you get. Maybe I will try again and give them another chance.

data.title: So far all visits have been good
data.text: Most of my visits have been on the very busy Taco Tuesday. Almost everyone goes then because the tacos are only $2 and the Margaritas are only $5. At full price I don't know if the Margaritas are really worth it, the tacos however are excellent and a good value even at their full price. Service is usually pretty good but it's hard to get excellent service when it's so busy on Taco Tuesday. Definitely a lively fun environment in downtown Gilbert. It's been a while since my last trip there, but I highly recommend it.

data.title: Two Sunday's in a Row...
data.text: For our second Sunday in a row, we have visited this hip-retro 70's Austin Powers decor taco place in old-town Gilbert. (It's a Scottsdale refurbished area with nicer folks.) The food is straight forward nouveau Mexican tacos. Great place to watch football on a Sunday evening. Retro 70's and 80's music with a New York feel.  The adobada, carnitas, Carne asada, crispy fish are all winners. We will be back to try the rest of the tacos on the menu, soon.

data.title: Just Ok
data.text: I was not impressed with the overpriced street tacos. I had shrimp tacos and the shrimp was so dry and over seasoned I had to eat it with the beans. The other items I had were OK.  I doubt I'll go back.

data.title: Yum!
data.text: Great food, blood orange margarita is awesome. A very busy place especially on Friday and Saturday nights.

data.title: Small portions. But okay
data.text: I thought is was expensive for what you got. The portions are small. Big bar so it's a bit noisy. Seems to be a trendy place. Outside seating.

data.title: Amazing Food and Drinks! You Must Go!
data.text: We stopped here for tacos and stumbled on Happy Hour! With our group of 6 (plus a dog - the patio is pet friendly!) we tried most of the tacos and ALL were delicious. We also ordered most of the margarita choices as well and were VERY happy with all the drinks. A really funky retro vibe inside and a relaxing patio with misters (and if need be - fireplace) on the patio. The staff couldn't have been more attentive, friendly and efficient. They came by and refilled our drinks to make sure we stayed hydrated while drinking in the heat without having to be asked. A great place to come hang out with friends!

data.title: Good Tacos, Friendly Service, a Tad Noisy.
data.text:
I went with some family members to try out the rumors!
We found to place very busy and hopping, but more a Sports Bar scene than a traditional Mexican place. We did specifically notice that it was very noisy with ambient noises, chatter, dinner sounds, even to a level that we all commented on it as distracting (maybe some sound absorbing materials could help that detraction)?
When the food arrived, the tacos were "human sized," (unlike a lot of other places where they are huge), but I'd actually say a bit small for expectations. I had crunchy fish and also Grilled Shrimp. The fish was very nice, and the shrimp had most excellent flavor but was cold (cold enough for me to think that is how they serve it)!
I also had an orange cucumber salad which was delicious and one other person had a garden variety salad which she loved!
The waitress -Kimberly, was wonderful and humorously cute as were our hostesses and other waiters, lots of smiles and personality! -- and might I add, very attentive! Bravo!
There is also lots of room for outside seating with a misting system, but we preferred inside in a booth.
Prepare for a very casual experience, but quite pleasant all in all!
As an afterthought, we happened to catch the "Happy Hour" window, so for three people our bill was only $30 (with one cocktail) so exceptionally reasonable!

data.title: Excellent Service, Very good Mexican Food.
data.text: Charming restaurant on Restaurant Row in downtown Gilbert, Arizona.  Maybe a little on the expensive side for Mexican Food.  But, they had  happy hour specials on Mexican Beers.  Our hostess was one of the best I have ever had.  She was diplomatic and efficient and had the most beautiful smiling blue eyes. I think she must be very intelligent.  She was brunette and had a small cross tattoo on one ankle.  So,  I hope she is there when you go.  I had a machaca burrito that was deep fried Chimi Style.  I thought it delicious. However,  some sour cream would have made it better.  Plenty of parking in back or behind the stores on the East side of Gilbert Road.  There is no charge for parking unlike Phoenix or Tempe so ya'll come to Gilbert!  My wife had a very small fish Taco whichshe thought marginal.  Patio dining is available.

data.title: Cute, casual and good Mexican food
data.text:
This restaurant is located on Gilbert Road in downtown Gilbert restaurant row, on the west side of the road across from Joe's BBQ.

We went to Sunday late lunch around 3 pm. It was packed and very noisy inside, so we requested to sit outside under a tree, with sails and misters.  Very pleasant!  The patio has a large wall complete with fireplace, which makes it delightfully private, quiet and cozy.

As soon as we were seated, we were greeted promptly with water and tasty chips and salsa. 

I ordered a crispy flour fish taco and a small (half pint) Dos Equis beer. The taco was good (but not crispy) but I expected more for $5.  My husband had a huge machacha beef burro with green chili on the side.  He said it was the best burro he's ever had in Arizona. Sour cream and guacamole was not offered.

I noticed another couple had ordered 2 taco trios and enjoyed them.  I might try that the next time we go.

There is ample parking in the rear and easy access into the restaurant.
